Fronklende grew around a wide, navigable river, and is comprised <span class="tip dotted" title=" Human: 72.99%, Halfling: 7.94%, Dwarf: 5.36%, Gnome: 3.84%, Half-Elf: 3.68%, Half-Orc: 1.95%, Elf: 1.87%, Dragonborn: 1.23%, Tiefling: 0.81%, Goblin: 0.34%">predominantly of humans</span>. town: <br><span class="first-character">F</span>ronklende is located in the temperate seashore, where the vegetation is lush. Fronklende grew around a wide, navigable river. They harvest sugar cane, and nearby is a region rich with bauxite deposits.They are a <span class="tip dotted" title="The crown gives land to the nobles in exchange for military service. Peasants work, tithe, and fight for the nobles in exchange for being able to live on the noble's lands.">feudalist</span> <span class="tip dotted" title="Governed by the wizards.">magocratic</span> <span class="tip dotted" title="An elected body of representatives wield the powers of government.">republic</span>. The nearest <span class="tip" title="This changes each time you click."><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">landmark</a></span> is <span id="random">a dried up river or stream, with the remains of a long forgotten exodus. Bones stick up through the mud at strange angles.</span> A population of 912, the denizens live a poor existence. An arrival of marching modrons is currently taking place.<br><h3>Government in Fronklende</h3>The people of Fronklende work the land in exchange for working their lord's lands. Affairs are handled by <span class="tip" id="leader"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">The Fronklende Cutpurses</a></span>, the head of whom is Mr <span class="tip" id="80cb6725-ec6f-499d-a941-ae738ef03b3c"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Adanno Whitney</a></span><br><h4>Economics</h4>Trade in Fronklende is regulated, with taxes and restrictions on what can be brought in and out of the hamlet, and people live a poor existence because of it. The trade guild enforces rules, with stiff penalties and trade bans for rule-breakers. Welfare is non existent. Citizens can expect the absolute bare minimum of death services. Healthcare and education are totally ignored, and those unable to fend for themselves starve. <h4>Law and Order</h4>There's a decent policing presence, and citizens know better than to step out of line, as <span class="tip" id="061a4f40-65cf-473b-9160-a298b7828ff2"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Band of the Crimson Lion</a></span> are armed. Despite this, brutality is rare, and citizens with nothing to hide have nothing to fear. Law in Fronklende is reform-based, and those that breach the laws can expect incarceration, fines, asylums, or work-release programs to provide them with the chance to not become a recidivist. The death penalty is reserved only for traitors to the state. Magic is typically only for the ruling class of mages who govern Fronklende. Those who cast spells within Fronklende are seen as politicians more than awe-inspiring heroes.<br>

43ce0e69-c5ff-4194-900f-c4fd4e64a545.name: The Town Square
43ce0e69-c5ff-4194-900f-c4fd4e64a545.output: <h1>The Town Square</h1><br>You're in the town square. It's huge and hectic, and somewhat dirty. It features a small marketplace with a couple of people selling out of carts. As you walk along, you see <span class="tip" id="8631adc9-ceaa-4759-9663-b0f9ed7553cc"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">a lithe halfling</a></span> riding a horse.<br>There's a <span class="tip" id="1658bb53-26d1-43f6-9c1e-b64a327f9714"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">beuraucrat</a></span> that's trying to calm an angry crowd. There's also a noticeboard, which has various posters, requests, and announcements tacked to it.<br><br><br><br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="poster"></div></span>

59aa6aa0-6f1e-49de-9fd2-5866f2282210.name: The Markets of Fronklende
59aa6aa0-6f1e-49de-9fd2-5866f2282210.output: <h1>The Markets of Fronklende</h1>You wander through the streets of Fronklende, and come across the market, which is located in a large, circular plaza. It seems that the vendors are organised by who bribed the market runners the most for the month. The market is known for rather pushy merchants, and is surprisingly clean. Today the market is incredibly busy, and people are piled up at different stalls all trying to look at the goods on display.<br><br><h3>Merchants</h3> <br>A <span class="tip" id="5e3cbccf-dcff-4faf-b5d3-9435b0aadcde"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">somewhat short woman with a very large nose</a></span> is selling rats and pigeons from a huge sack the merchant has set down on the ground.<br><br>Nearby, a <span class="tip" id="5267d4c2-47d5-4c64-9f45-caeae312568a"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">overweight human</a></span> is saying loudly "Scabbards with monsters getting stabbed on them! Scare them before you even start! Half price!" from a flimsy wooden booth.<br><br>A <span class="tip" id="a3c59a60-b361-4792-8c8c-e638b3105835"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">white skinned barely five foot human</a></span> is selling amulets and totems from a myriad of pockets in the vendor's clothes.<br><br>Nearby, a <span class="tip" id="db9356d5-51bc-4d54-abb4-1cc572cc4fde"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">fat, but muscular too female dwarf</a></span> is beckoning "Owlbear beaks for sale! Guaranteed protection from scurvy!<blockquote>Well, no protection against anything really.</blockquote> Be the envy of your friends!" from a large rug on which the vendor has laid out the merchandise.<br><br><br><br>

bb210a1a-6b26-482b-a647-67e6baea1111.name: Kathrine's Docks
bb210a1a-6b26-482b-a647-67e6baea1111.output: <h1>Kathrine's Docks</h1><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou walk down to the docks, which are known best for a peculiar ship docked here, constricted from living trees fed from it's soil filled hull. You notice a large crowd gathered in front of an absolutely gargantuan severely damaged ship slowly drifting into port. The docks are small, and clearly geared towards smaller vessels such as fishing ships. You could probably fit a large ship in, if you were lucky, and is disgusting. All types of moulds, algae, and other unspeakably slimy things are on display here.. It's currently rather peaceful, the silence only disturbed by the gentle lapping of water against rocks.<br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="ships"> <div class="classTable"> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Type</th> <th>Delete</th> </tr> <tr> <td> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Axe of Thard</a> </td> <td> Caravel </td> <td> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">x</a> </td> </tr> </table> </div> </div></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>People Around</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>

9135538a-553d-4a34-bed0-a411118044a3.name: Vile Bottle
9135538a-553d-4a34-bed0-a411118044a3.output: <h1>Vile Bottle</h1> <br><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou enter Vile Bottle, a poorly made plaster potion shop with a red undefined roof. Looking around, Vile Bottle must have had an explosion the day before; there is no other possible reason that a shop that deals with magical, often volatile chemicals would be so cluttered, crowded, and blatantly a danger to itself and the half-mile radius surrounding it. There are pots and pans of mixtures that have already spilt over crowding the desk, with potions that are currently brewing strewn around the floor. There's little hope to walk through the shop without putting your boot in something that you probably would prefer not to put it in. Just as you try and hesitate, you hear the distinct sound of 'no, please don't go!' come from the floorboards, which at first seemed to be sticky, but on closer inspection, was more... 'grabby'. There is a chemist behind the shop counter currently sprinkling what looks like gold shavings into a large copper pot.<br><br><h3>Chemist</h3><br>The built like a brick shithouse chemist checks you out for just a moment before smiling at you when you come inside. He introduces himself as <span class="tip" id="dc4e2a88-21f4-4f1c-8195-a296a59c3b63"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Fallond Battlehammer</a></span>, the master chemist of the shop, and asks what he can do for you.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Talk with Fallond Battlehammer</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0"><h4>Generate plothook</h4></a><span id="chemistMission"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0"><h6>Generate a random potion!</h6></a><span id="randpotion"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Buy something</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Customers</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>

You notice a rack of discount breads near the front door.<br><br>This bakeshop is known for giving fair prices for decent baked goods. There is a <span class="tip" id="47f5a664-8e92-4228-8dfe-63cfda462793"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">built like a brick shithouse female half-orc</a></span> currently boxing up some baked goods for sale. 36aa0a3c-e4ea-49d7-92de-a81ebd9f61ae.name: The Low-Cost Shop
36aa0a3c-e4ea-49d7-92de-a81ebd9f61ae.output: <h1>The Low-Cost Shop</h1><br><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou make your way down Queens Avenue, and enter a crumbling straw general store with a planked roof and see that inside, the huge building is dangerously messy. Several bins seemed to be cluttered with assorted keys. You notice there are magical barriers prevent people from handling the merchandise. The store's shopkeep is currently stacking up boxes of goods behind the shop counter.<br><br><h3>Shopkeeper</h3><br>The shopkeep checks you out for just a moment before smiling at you while you look around. She introduces herself as <span class="tip" id="e9adbd3c-4bb6-4079-b570-44c1fe42e1e2"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Elisybeth Wilde</a></span>, the owner of the General Store, and lets you know that the store is currently having a buy one get one 50% off deal. Elisybeth seems annoyed to have customers in the shop.<br><br><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h4>Buy something</h4></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br>

0ddbdcde-209d-4fde-a590-8c2cf884398a.name: The Oubliette of Ashdown
0ddbdcde-209d-4fde-a590-8c2cf884398a.output: <h1>The Oubliette of Ashdown</h1>The Oubliette of Ashdown is on the inside of a bend in a river and was built long before most of the castle. It is known for a mass escape in the past, and consists of an endless series of long corridors. It is rumoured that hidden inside the dungeon is the remnants of a long-lost hero.<br><h4>Cells</h4>The cells inside the dungeon are aging, but sturdy; the walls have some cracks, and prisoners are kept in individual cells, but they can hear other prisoners. Prisoners of The Oubliette of Ashdown are treated like dogs; they receive poor quality meals and enough healing to keep them alive. The jailer, <span class="tip" id="df23cb2d-d359-40f6-86a6-dd1a134d6d45"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Kayla Millerchip</a></span>, is a deformed wretch of a person, forced to work in the dungeon to keep them out of the way.<br><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Meet a prisoner</a><br><span class="macro-live macro-live-block"><div id="prisoners"></div></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="df23cb2d-d359-40f6-86a6-dd1a134d6d45"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Kayla Millerchip</a></span></td> <td>Human</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="Supervises a jail and the prisoners in it.">Jailer</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="The Oubliette of Ashdown is a workplace to Kayla">Jailer</span></td></tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="fe41c8bc-d55f-4712-8146-78357fae0d20"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Tago Ashdown</a></span></td> <td>Human</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="An expert in or student of history, especially that of a particular period, geographical region, or social phenomenon.">Historian</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="The Oubliette of Ashdown is a Dungeon named after her to Tago">Namesake</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div>

51740576-3421-46f1-ab35-f36171f27097.name: The Polished Copper
51740576-3421-46f1-ab35-f36171f27097.output: <h1>The Polished Copper</h1><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou make your way down High Lane, and enter The Polished Copper and see that inside, the structurally unsound cob smithy with a straw roof is quite large. The smithy is filthy, with smoke having blackened the walls and a thick layer of grime and dust coating every surface. The smell of various burnt woods, coals, and other things permeates your nostrils, and your boots leave visible footprints in the ash underfoot. There is a blacksmith currently stocking the forge with fresh coals.<br>On the bench lies a dagger. It's obviously amateurish. Murgen moves around the shop, unsure of herself, betraying her lack of skills.<br><br><h3>Blacksmith</h3>The blacksmith grunts in your direction when you walk in as soon as you come through the door. She introduces herself as <span class="tip" id="d1018f2c-4da8-4b0c-990f-4542ee96ed3c"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Murgen Dargakk</a></span>, the owner of the smithy, and asks what she can do for you.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Talk with Murgen Dargakk</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0"><h4>Generate plothook</h4></a><span id="blacksmithMission"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkappend" tabindex="0"><h4>Buy something</h4></a><span class="macro-linkappend-insert macro-linkappend-in"></span><br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Customers</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span>

You notice several body forms fitted with quite regal clothing.<br><br>This garment store is known for having the most trendy clothing available. There is a <span class="tip" id="c469d599-97e6-4788-867c-ee88476a79bc"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">translucent skinned relatively short human</a></span> currently taking the measurements of a particularly gruff looking half-orc. 618441ae-752f-4552-a28f-91d05943b39a.name: Tickle & Feather
618441ae-752f-4552-a28f-91d05943b39a.output: <h1>Tickle &amp; Feather</h1><span class="first-character">Y</span>ou make your way down Priest Alley, and enter Tickle &amp; Feather a hewn rock brothel with a weathered white undefined roof. Inside, the spacious hewn rock building is fastidious. You notice several deep shouts of pleasure from a distant room.<br>When people talk about Tickle &amp; Feather, they say the booze is cheap and the women are busty. Apparently, it specialises in slave trading. All the people here have a price..<br>Rumours abound in whorehouses, and Tickle &amp; Feather is no different; apparently, the prostitutes here were all orphans taken in by the original owner.<br><br><h3>Brothel Master</h3><br>The Master is laying in a particularly plush looking gray chaise lounge, he appears to be a rugged and grizzled rogue. After a few minutes the halfling nods at you, and quickly walks over to where you are. He introduces himself as <span class="tip" id="435b4ef4-7872-4131-9460-9e81c321cd91"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Garret Wiseacre</a></span>, the Master of Tickle &amp; Feather, and asks what he can do for you.<br><br>

You notice a large bowl of coagulated blood is sitting in the shop window.<br><br>This coiffeur is known for being the best place to get the local gossip. There is a <span class="tip" id="5234feb4-62b0-4509-bad6-454da33bbd84"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">middle aged dragonborn</a></span> currently placing teeth into a large jar. leader.name: The Fronklende Cutpurses
leader.output: <h1>The Fronklende Cutpurses</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Fronklende Cutpurses is a thieves guild. It's new, and the miniscule faction has a good reputation, and is motivated by money. They are recently associated in allegations of bribery.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="80cb6725-ec6f-499d-a941-ae738ef03b3c"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Adanno Whitney</a></span>, who was able to oust the previous leadership. He is of mild competence, and his position is rapidly disintegrating due to internal power struggles. Bribes will usually be rejected. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Fronklende Cutpurses are identifiable by a grey hood. Membership requires a display of bravery, and costs three hundred gold pieces, provided there's an empty slot. The initiation into The Fronklende Cutpurses involves a secret ritual.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="80cb6725-ec6f-499d-a941-ae738ef03b3c"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Adanno Whitney</a></span></td> <td>Human</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="A sneaky person.">Rogue</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of The Fronklende Cutpurses, and is of mild competence.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A handful of gems are jealously guarded, as are one or two contacts, one or two valuable artifacts, barely enough gold, and sheafs of blackmail material. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Fronklende Cutpurses have barely any allies; Three or four seers are the only others they can rely on. <br><br>The Fronklende Cutpurses have enemies around every corner; A guild of commoners wish ill of The Fronklende Cutpurses. Their other enemies also include a guild of priests, a guild of commoners, a guild of commoners, and a guild of priests.

f2a2cb91-c517-4ad4-ac3d-a498dbea05c5.name: The Purposely Unwashed
f2a2cb91-c517-4ad4-ac3d-a498dbea05c5.output: <h1>The Purposely Unwashed</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Purposely Unwashed is a monks group. It's relatively new, and the slightly below average sized faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by fame. They are distrusted by the people.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by a committee of 6, who were able to rise to power through nepotism. They are of mild competence, and their positions on the committee are rapidly disintegrating due to conflicts with rivaling factions. Their meetings are held whenever a leader calls them, and are are open to people accompanied by a member. Bribes to the committee are scorned. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Purposely Unwashed are identifiable by their shaved heads. Membership requires referral by an existing member, and costs three hundred gold pieces, provided there's an empty slot. The initiation into The Purposely Unwashed involves a simple form to be filled.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> </div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limited resources. A handful of trade goods and one or two valuable magical weapons are their only significant resources. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Purposely Unwashed have some strong allies; A veritable army of fellow monks and a guild of commoners can be called on for aid. <br><br>The Purposely Unwashed have more enemies than one would expect; A guild of bandits are rivals. Other enemies include a guild of priests, and a guild of bandits.

a390d761-620e-4918-9fff-3c30071ecedf.name: The Strong Pikesmen
a390d761-620e-4918-9fff-3c30071ecedf.output: <h1>The Strong Pikesmen</h1><br><span class="first-character">T</span>he Strong Pikesmen is a military army. It's quite new, and the tiny faction has a quite poor reputation, and is motivated by glory. They are rumoured to own a powerful artifact.<br><br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="23ced863-e446-4c55-8081-56eb66c5ebdd"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Jaeden Clay</a></span>, who was the strongest of the group. He is reasonably competent, and his position is rapidly disintegrating due to conflicts with rivaling factions. Bribes are sometimes accepted. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of The Strong Pikesmen are identifiable by their love of a good fight. Membership requires some social status, and costs five hundred gold pieces, provided there's an empty slot. The initiation into The Strong Pikesmen involves a simple form to be filled.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="23ced863-e446-4c55-8081-56eb66c5ebdd"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Jaeden Clay</a></span></td> <td>Human</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="A common warrior.">Fighter</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of The Strong Pikesmen, and is reasonably competent.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have limitless resources. A handful of contacts are part of those resources. Also at their disposal are a drawer of blackmail material, a handful of favours, one or two valuable trade goods, and a handful of gems. <br><h3>Politics</h3>The Strong Pikesmen have a couple trusted allies; Three or four scholars are the only others they can rely on. <br><br>The Strong Pikesmen have some fearsome enemies; A guild of assassins wish ill of The Strong Pikesmen. Their other enemies also include a guild of assassins, a guild of bandits, and a guild of bandits.

061a4f40-65cf-473b-9160-a298b7828ff2.name: Band of the Crimson Lion
061a4f40-65cf-473b-9160-a298b7828ff2.output: <h1>Band of the Crimson Lion</h1><br><span class="first-character">B</span>and of the Crimson Lion is a guards watch. It's well established, and the miniscule faction has an extremely poor reputation, and is motivated by politics. They are against the current political regime.<br><h3>Policing</h3><br>Fronklende is policed by Band of the Crimson Lion, rather than a separate guard. The guard is underfunded, and their equipment is always in slight disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions when public pressure fors for it, though Band of the Crimson Lion does not have the funding to perform training exercises.<br><br>One can recognise a member of Band of the Crimson Lion by the magenta and tan livery adorned with an image of a hammer.<br><h4>Law in Fronklende</h4><br>Law in Fronklende is reform-based, and those that breach the laws can expect incarceration, fines, asylums, or work-release programs to provide them with the chance to not become a recidivist. The death penalty is reserved only for traitors to the state.<br><h3>Governance</h3>It's ruled by <span class="tip" id="79d3d238-b929-4eb3-90ca-2483f27e52eb"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Ryla Butcher</a></span>, who was the strongest of the group. She is reasonably competent, and her position is stable due to the lack of infighting for the leadership role. Bribes will be bargained about. <br><h3>Members</h3><br>Members of Band of the Crimson Lion are identifiable by following any order given to them. Membership requires some social status, and costs fifty gold pieces. The initiation into Band of the Crimson Lion involves a secret ritual.<br><a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0"><h4>Create Members</h4></a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert macro-linkreplace-in"></span><br><div id="BuildingRelationshipsTable"> <div class="classTable"> <h3>Relationships</h3> <table> <tr> <th>Name</th> <th>Race</th> <th>Occupation</th> <th>Relationship</th> </tr> <tr><td><span class="tip" id="79d3d238-b929-4eb3-90ca-2483f27e52eb"> <a class="link-internal macro-link" tabindex="0">Ryla Butcher</a></span></td> <td>Human</td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="A common warrior.">Fighter</span></td> <td><span class="tip dotted" title="[object Object] is the leader of Band of the Crimson Lion, and is reasonably competent.">Head of Faction</span></td></tr> </table> </div></div><br><h3>Resources</h3>They have many resources. A drawer of blackmail material are jealously guarded, as are one or two valuable gems, and some artifacts. <br><h3>Politics</h3>Band of the Crimson Lion have few allies; Three or four priests are the only others they can rely on. <br><br>Band of the Crimson Lion have a handful of rivals; Three or four bandits and a handful of bandits are the only that wish Band of the Crimson Lion ill.

04e465c7-a241-4e7e-884f-83776c0c6797.name: Rivaan Grrrmmballhyst
04e465c7-a241-4e7e-884f-83776c0c6797.output: <br><span class="first-character">R</span>ivaan Grrrmmballhyst is <span class="tip dotted" title="36 years old, to be exact.">an adult</span> male dragonborn. He is <span class="tip dotted" title="6ft. 3">rather tall</span> and <span class="tip dotted" title="210lbs. (with a BMI of 24)">overweight</span>, and has amber eyes with fair skin. The most notable physical trait of Rivaan is that he has a scar on the nose.<br><br>Rivaan cannot resist making snide comments. When he is relaxed, he is reserved. In moments of stress, he becomes determined. Religion-wise, Rivaan is a quiet true believer. <br><br>Rivaan is a <span class="tip dotted" title="Unlawfully occupies an uninhabited building or unused land.">squatter</span>, with a background of being a gladiator. He belongs to the <span class="tip dotted" title="Rivaan lives a squalid existence, eating terrible food with no alcohol, and few creature comforts">paupery</span> social class. <br><br>Rivaan currently has 12 sp and 7 gp in his pockets, and 50 Gold 2 Silver 2 Copper to his name. Rivaan knows Common and Draconic. He is bisexual<br>Rivaan currently earns 1 Silver 3 Copper <a class="link-internal macro-linkreplace" tabindex="0">per day.</a><span class="macro-linkreplace-insert
